page.title: 19DUNDONALD CASTLE
page.content: The village of Dundonald is dominated by a 13th Century castle which stands on a hill overlooking the village.But long before the present castle was built there was a fort _ "dun" belonging to someone called Donald on the same hill, hence the present name of the village _ Dundonald! Although the castle today is a ruin, it is still water_tight because of its beautifully constructed vaulted stone roof. The castle is looked after by the Scottish Development Department because of its historical interest. Scotland was actually ruled for a time from Dundonald Castle, for Marjory (daughter of Robert the Bruce) who lived there, had a son who became Robert II of Scotland. Although a ruin, the Castle makes an imposing background to the village and the surrounding countryside.
